channel.title: Editing a compiler so it works with your java
channel.description: How do you edit a compiler so it works with your java? and how do you find out what java you have?

item.title: Editing a compiler so it works with your java
item.dc:creator: @gon3d34d123 gon3d34d123
item.description:
@gon3d34d123 wrote:

Np

item.title: Editing a compiler so it works with your java
item.dc:creator: @p00n99range p00n99range
item.description:
@p00n99range wrote:

[quote=“gon3d34d123, post:2, topic:288613”]@echo off title Compiling Shantaram v.19 ~Full server~ color 0a if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

This works even if you dont know.[/quote]

Thanks!!! It worked, I just had to change the title
and color to 70.
Thanks! If I could I would rep you

Read full topic
item.source: Editing a compiler so it works with your java

item.title: Editing a compiler so it works with your java
item.dc:creator: @_ballin_jr *ballin jr.*
item.description:
@_ballin_jr wrote:

To answer your question, in your compiler.bat, you usually have a line of code like this(or close):

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe" *.java >> log.txt

You see where it says? jdk1.6.0_14
It just means that your current JDK is Update 14. So if you had JDK Update 10; You’d replace the 14 with a 10. Hope it helped you out.

Read full topic
item.source: Editing a compiler so it works with your java

item.title: Editing a compiler so it works with your java
item.dc:creator: @gon3d34d123 gon3d34d123
item.description:
@gon3d34d123 wrote:

@echo off title Compiling Shantaram v.19 ~Full server~ color 0a if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

This works even if you dont know.
